Source code for tests.simulation.conf.test_settings

import unittest
from simulation.conf.settings import Settings


[docs]class SettingsTest(unittest.TestCase):
    """Test case docstring"""

[docs]    def setUp(self):
        self.start_value = Settings().data


[docs]    def test_get(self):
        settings = Settings()
        ret = settings.get('niema', 2)
        self.assertEqual(ret , 2)


[docs]    def test_get_ex(self):
        settings = Settings()
        settings['density'] = 0.001
        ret = settings.get('density')
        self.assertEqual(0.001, ret)


[docs]    def test_set_valuerr(self):
        settings = Settings()
        settings['density1'] = 'ala1'
        ret = settings.get('density1')
        self.assertEqual('ala1', ret)


[docs]    def test_set_tofloat(self):
        settings = Settings()
        settings['densitystr'] = '0.001'
        ret = settings.get('densitystr')
        self.assertEqual(float('0.001'), ret)


[docs]    def test_setdata(self):
        test = Settings()
        value_set = {"aldor": "dwa"}
        test.data = value_set
        self.assertEqual(test.data, value_set)
        Settings().data = self.start_value


[docs]    def test_setdataerr(self):
        test = Settings()
        value_set = ["aldor", "dwa"]
        self.assertRaises(ValueError, setattr,test, 'data',  value_set)


[docs]    def tearDown(self):
        Settings().data = self.start_value
